message.content: We can factor the first equation into $(6x-1)(3x+3) = 0$, which gives us $x = -1$ or $x=\frac{1}{6}$. We can factor the second equation into $(2x+1)(2x+3) = 0$, which gives us $x = -\frac{1}{2}$ or $x = -\frac{3}{2}$. The only value of $x$ that satisfies both equations is $\boxed{-1}$.
